attributes.action: act as inter - mediary, support Secretaries of State, like Jacqui Smith and Patricia Hewitt, against Trade Union fury - don't lose individuals of calibre, who lead professions, through intense pressures of govt ministerial office. We the undersigned support police concerns about their limited rights to strike, compared to the industrial employment liberties of other workers, but equally urge the Police Confederation to recognise, that NO GOVT SHOULD BE HELD TO RANSOM, when it's administration is trying to protect the public.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
AOL today reports, 

"Police are expected to hold Ms Smith responsible for the prospect of the first police strike for 90 years.
The Police Federation said 86% of its members want to lobby for the same industrial rights as other workers if the Government is not bound to honour arbitrated pay deals."

More than 20,000 officers marched on Westminster in January over Ms Smith's decision to introduce a 2.5% pay rise in stages, effectively reducing the overall award to 1.9%. Wot more policing !
